channel.title: Golang Weekly
channel.description: A weekly newsletter about the Go programming language

item.title: „ÄêHow much does a Go book author make?„ÄëGo Book‰ΩúËÄÖËµöÂ§öÂ∞ëÈí±Ôºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã549 ‚Äî April 9, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Faster Shuffling in Go with Batching ‚Äî Put down that deck of cards.. ‚Äòshuffling‚Äô here refers to moving the contents of an array about. It is based on expensive random integer generation. Here, Daniel offers up a couple of algorithms that speed things up by 2-3X compared to Go‚Äôs standard Fisher-Yates¬†shuffle.

Daniel Lemire

More Predictable Benchmarking with testing.B.Loop ‚Äî Go 1.24 introduced a new way to write benchmarks that avoids common pitfalls like accidental dead-code elimination and inaccurate timings. If you want faster, more accurate, and more intuitive benchmarking, this is for¬†you.

Junyang Shao

Does Your Postgres Database Feel Like a Black Box? ‚Äî Are you prepared for the next high-traffic event? Join us April 16 to explore pganalyze features that tune slow queries, catch regressions, and keep Postgres running at its¬†best.

pganalyze sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • A Go developer explains how he worked with Go and React to build his new custom blog stack.

  • üìà Is Go still growing? JetBrains reflects on the results of some surveys that took place over the past year.

  • üìï Teiva Harsanyi shares the story of writing the book 100 Go Mistakes for Manning. It all started with his post The Top 10 Most Common Mistakes I‚Äôve Seen in Go Projects which was Go Weekly's most clicked item in 2019. How much does an author make from a successful Go book? Find out here.

Life as a Go Developer on Windows ‚Äî Go officially supports Windows as a first-class platform, but supporting a product across numerous operating systems still requires some work. For Windows that means juggling WSL quirks, file system oddities, toolchains, and platform-specific¬†code.

Zach Musgrave (DoltHub)

Porting Tailscale to Plan 9 ‚Äî A fun story from former Go core team member Brad Fitzpatrick on Tailscale‚Äôs April Fools‚Äô Day project to port Tailscale to Bell Labs‚Äô 1980s Plan 9 OS. It was no joke, though, and actually works, despite the Go compiler‚Äôs support for Plan 9 having some ‚Äúbitrot.‚Äù

Brad Fitzpatrick

üí∞ In other Tailscale news, Tailscale has just raised $160m.

üìÑ Five Interesting Go Web Frameworks ‚Äì A quick look at Gin, Echo, Fiber, Beego and Buffalo, and their key use cases, as well as a little bonus¬†item.. Jeffrey Morhous

üìÑ Go‚Äôs Best-Kept Secret: Executable Examples John Arundel

üõ† Code & Tools

Chroma 2.16: Pure Go Syntax Highlighting ‚Äî Take source code and turn it into syntax highlighted HTML, ANSI colored text, or just grab the raw tokens in JSON. Brings most of the features of Pygments to Go and can use Pygments‚Äô lexers and styles too. There‚Äôs an online playground where you can try it¬†out.

Alec Thomas

Go Panicked Again? Yeah, Sentry Saw It‚Äîand Kept the Receipts ‚Äî Goroutines are great‚Äîuntil one quietly dies. Sentry catches panics, traces them back, and gives you full context. üëâ Try it free before your next deploy gets¬†weird.

Sentry sponsor

GitHub MCP Server: GitHub's Official MCP Server ‚Äî As the Model Context Protocol continues to move toward industry-standard status for giving AI agents more powers to interact with things outside their usual sandbox, GitHub has released its official server, which you can integrate with VS Code and Claude Desktop. It supports loads of tools for issues, PRs, repos, and¬†more.

GitHub

go-i18n 2.6: Translate Your Go Program Into Multiple Languages ‚Äî A package and tool for translating Go programs into different (natural) languages. v2.6 now requires Go¬†1.23+.

Nick Snyder

Genanki: A Go Library for Generating Anki Decks ‚Äî Anki is a popular tool for flashcard, spaced attention style¬†learning.

Mykyta Kysil

  • httpmock 1.4 ‚Äì Easy mocking of HTTP responses from external¬†resources.

  • go-github 71.0 ‚Äì Go client library for accessing the GitHub API¬†v3.

  • fsnotify 1.9 ‚Äì Cross-platform file system notifications in¬†Go.

  • go-ansible 2.2 ‚Äì Execute Ansible commands directly from¬†Go.

  • BadgerDB 4.7 ‚Äì Fast Go-powered key/value¬†database.

  • GoBGP 3.36 ‚Äì BGP implementation in¬†Go.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Zach MusgraveÔºàDolthubÔºâ

- ÂâçGOÊ†∏ÂøÉÂõ¢ÈòüÊàêÂëòÂ∏ÉÊãâÂæ∑¬∑Ëè≤Ëå®Â∏ïÁâπÈáåÂÖãÔºàBrad FitzpatrickÔºâÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÊïÖ‰∫ãÔºåÂú®Â∞æÂ∑¥‰∏äÁöÑ„ÄäÊÑö‰∫∫ËäÇ„ÄãÔºàApril ScaleÔºâÁöÑ„ÄäÊÑö‰∫∫ËäÇ„ÄãÈ°πÁõÆ‰∏äÔºåÂà∞Ë¥ùÂ∞îÂÆûÈ™åÂÆ§ÔºàBell LabsÔºâÁöÑ1980Âπ¥‰ª£

item.title: „ÄêForget TypeScript, how about porting Doom to Go?„ÄëÂøòËÆ∞ÊâìÂ≠óÁ®øÔºåÁßªÊ§çÂéÑËøêÊÄé‰πàÂäûÔºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã546 ‚Äî March 19, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Traversal-Resistant File APIs ‚Äî Among the lesser known new features in recent versions of Go are some ways to improve file system security when end user input might have an impact on file paths your app tries to access, including os.Root, filepath.IsLocal, filepath.EvalSymLinks and filepath.Localize. A must¬†read.

Damien Neil

Were Multiple Return Values a Mistake for Go? ‚Äî An interesting technical post critiquing the effects of one of Go‚Äôs earliest design decisions. This is an area where opinions will differ strongly, but the author thinks Go sorely needs to support¬†tuples.

Mond

üìÖ Live Workshop: Build Production-Ready Apps with JavaScript & Go ‚Äî Join Maximiliano Firtman next week (online or in-person) for a 3-day workshop, learning how to build real-world, fully functional web apps using vanilla JS & Go. Create performant, scalable¬†apps.

Frontend Masters sponsor

TypeScript's Go Port Already Leading to Optimizations for Go ‚Äî Last week‚Äôs big news was about the TypeScript compiler being ported to Go for performance reasons. A neat side effect of such a large project entering our ecosystem is the increased potential for even more performance improvements for Go¬†itself, something that has already begun to¬†occur..

GitHub Go Repo

Go Structs and Interfaces Made Simple ‚Äî An introduction (or refresher) of Go‚Äôs core building blocks when it comes to working with data types and structs ‚Äì an approach that differs somewhat from those favored in object oriented languages like C++ or¬†Java.

Deven J (Stream)

üìÑ Benchmarking: What You Can't Miss in Go 1.24 Jakub Jarosz

üìÑ How GitHub Engineers Learn New Codebases Brittany Ellich (GitHub)

üì∫ How to Implement Server-Sent Events in Go Alex Pliutau

üõ† Code & Tools

doomgeneric: Doom, Ported to Go? ‚Äî If classic 90s FPS Doom can be ported to JavaScript and made to run inside a PDF, a Go port should be a piece of cake, right? Here‚Äôs a little slice of magic involving using the ccgo C-to-Go¬†compiler. Don't get too excited though as it's a limited proof of concept and Linux only, but it's neat to see what ccgo is capable¬†of.

cznic

golang-set: A Simple, Well-Tested, Generic Set Type ‚Äî ‚ÄúUntil Go has sets built-in‚Ä¶use this.‚Äù The latest v2.8 release adds support for Go 1.23‚Äôs range-over-func¬†iteration.

Ralph Caraveo

üîí Protect Against AI Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

DiceDB: A Reactive, In-Memory Database Optimized for Modern¬†Hardware ‚Äî A new Go-powered database! Dice is a reactive database where your clients subscribe to receive changes immediately and it seems to take a lot of inspiration from the Redis approach being both in-memory and with simple Redis-like commands. GitHub¬†repo.

DiceDB

Participle: A Simple Library for Defining Parsers ‚Äî Provides a straightforward yet idiomatic way to define parsers in Go using a familiar approach of using struct field tags to define a grammar, so if you‚Äôve used encoding/json before, you‚Äôre well on your¬†way.

Alec Thomas

  • Glamour 0.9 ‚Äì Stylesheet-based Markdown rendering for CLI apps, now with better syntax highlight and¬†tables.

  • Toxiproxy 2.12 ‚Äì Simulate 'chaotic' network conditions in both testing and development¬†environments.

  • üêç Viper 1.20 ‚Äì Config solution for Go apps supporting various file formats and environment¬†variables.

  • üì∞ Fusion 0.9 ‚Äì Lightweight, self-contained feed aggregator and reader. Built with Go, SQLite, and¬†Svelte.

  • go-github v70.0.0 ‚Äì Go client library for accessing the GitHub API v3.

  • River v0.19 ‚Äì Robust job processing system for Go and Postgres.

  • GoReleaser v2.8 ‚Äì Mostly improvements to the Pro version.

  • TOML 1.5 ‚Äì TOML config file parser for¬†Go.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

mond

github go repo

- GOÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÊûÑÂª∫ÂùóÁöÑÁÆÄ‰ªãÔºàÊàñÂà∑Êñ∞ÔºâÂú®‰ΩøÁî®Êï∞ÊçÆÁ±ªÂûãÂíåÁªìÊûÑÊó∂ - ËøôÁßçÊñπÊ≥ï‰∏éÂú®C ++ÊàñJavaÔºà‰æãÂ¶ÇC ++ÊàñJavaÔºâ‰∏≠ÂèóÂà∞ÂØπË±°ÁöÑËØ≠Ë®Ä‰∏≠ÊúâÊâÄ‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ï„ÄÇ

„ÄÇ

deven JÔºàÊµÅÔºâ

üìÑüìÑüì∫

- Êèê‰æõ‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÁßçÁõ¥Êé•‰ΩÜÊÉØÁî®ÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ïÊù•ÂÆö‰πâËß£ÊûêÂô®Ôºå‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®ÁÜüÊÇâÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ï‰ΩøÁî®struct fieldÊ†áÁ≠æÊù•ÂÆö‰πâËØ≠Ê≥ïÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊÇ®Âú®Ë∑Ø‰∏ä‰ΩøÁî®ÁºñÁ†Å>ÁºñÁ†Å>ÁºñÁ†Å>ÁºñÁ†Å>ÔºåÊÇ®Â∞±Âú®Ë∑Ø‰∏äÂæàÂ•Ω„ÄÇ

item.title: „ÄêWhen is it OK to panic in Go?„Äë‰ªÄ‰πàÊó∂ÂÄôÂèØ‰ª•ÊÅêÊÖåÔºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã548 ‚Äî April 2, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

A Guide to Optimizing for High Performance in Go ‚Äî An in-progress collection of technical articles aimed at helping Go developers write faster, more efficient apps. The initial focus is on common patterns like object pooling, struct field alignment, and using worker pools, with a guide to high-performance networking set to follow¬†soon.

Alexander Stavonin

Goodbye Core Types, Hello Go As We Know and Love It ‚Äî A look at Go‚Äôs evolving type system, revealing how the abstraction of core types (introduced with generics in Go 1.18) complicated otherwise straightforward language features, and how their removal in Go 1.25 is set to simplify both the spec and everyday coding. (Hacker News reactions here.)

Robert Griesemer (Go Core Team)

2X-40X Faster Docker Builds with Blacksmith ‚Äî With a one-line code change, Blacksmith can make your Docker builds incremental by mounting your Docker layer cache into your GitHub Actions runner. Blacksmith is used by 300+ companies like Ashby, Clerk, and¬†Mintlify.

Blacksmith sponsor

When is it OK to Panic in Go? ‚Äî One of the Go proverbs is ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt panic,‚Äù which isn‚Äôt just good life advice but also saying not to use panic for normal error handling. Alex explores panic and some times when you should use¬†it.

Alex Edwards

IN BRIEF:

  • Go 1.24.2 and 1.23.8 have been released including security fixes to¬†net/http.

  • Did you know the Go gopher, as designed by Ren√©e French, is over 25 years old? 11 years ago, Rob Pike and Andrew Gerrand told the story of Go's popular mascot on the Go blog.

  • üìà The latest TIOBE index of programming language popularity is out with Go moving up from 8th to 7th¬†position.

The First Newsletter Dedicated to Product Engineers ‚Äî Learn strategies and tactics you need to succeed as a product engineer (and build products users¬†love).

PostHog sponsor

üì∫ Go Concurrency from the Beginning ‚Äì A nifty 8 minute video quickly touring Go‚Äôs concurrency mechanisms using basic¬†examples. Living, Etc.

üìÑ Building a Real-Time Notification System in Go with Postgres Ravi (Finly)

üìÑ Interfacing with WebAssembly in Go David Desmarais-Michaud

üìÑ Building a Network Vulnerability Scanner with Go Rez Moss (Sitepoint)

üìÑ 5 GitHub Actions Every Maintainer Needs to Know Finley and Davis (GitHub)

üõ† Code & Tools

Introducing ls-lint: A File Structure Linter ‚Äî Billing itself as an ‚Äòextremely fast file and directory name linter‚Äô, ls-lint is a Go powered tool for enforcing some structure over a project‚Äôs filesystem and naming policies. GitHub¬†repo.

Lucas L√∂ffel

urfave/cli 3.1: A Declarative Way to Build Go CLI Apps ‚Äî The manual outlines all of the key features, but think shell auto-completion, option parsing, help text, etc.

Jeremy Saenz and Contributors

Revive 1.8: A Faster, Configurable, Flexible Linter for Go ‚Äî A drop-in replacement of golint that aims to provide a little more structure, configurability, and performance. It‚Äôs used by numerous large Go projects and libraries. The README on the GitHub repo explains how it differs to golint.

Minko Gechev

asciigraph: ASCII Line Graph Rendering Library ‚Äî A longstanding library for rendering basic line graphs in ASCII text, such as at the terminal, all with no¬†dependencies.

Rohit Gupta

Prefixed UUIDs: A Package That Adds Type-Safe Prefixes to UUIDs
Khaja Minhajuddin

  • DoltgreSQL 1.51 ‚Äì Version controlled Postgres-a-like with Git-like¬†functionality.

  • Validator 10.26 ‚Äì Value validations for structs and fields based on¬†tags.

  • Buf 1.51 ‚Äì Tool for working with Protocol¬†Buffers.

  • Clickhouse Go 2.34 ‚Äì Go driver for¬†ClickHouse.

  • Colly 2.2 ‚Äì Go scraper and crawler¬†framework.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Jeremy SaenzÂíåË¥°ÁåÆËÄÖ

ÁöÑIble Linter - ÊààÊûóÁöÑÂÄíÂÖ•ÊõøÊç¢ÔºåÊó®Âú®Êèê‰æõÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÁªìÊûÑÔºåÂèØÈÖçÁΩÆÊÄßÂíåÊÄßËÉΩ„ÄÇÂÆÉË¢´ËÆ∏Â§öÂ§ßÂûãGOÈ°πÁõÆÂíåÂõæ‰π¶È¶Ü‰ΩøÁî®„ÄÇ github repo Ëß£ÈáäÂÆÉÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂ∑ÆÂºÇÂà∞ golint

Minko Gechev

item.title: „ÄêHow and why PlanetScale built a VM in Go„ÄëPlanetscaleÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰ª•Âèä‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàÂú®Go‰∏≠ÊûÑÂª∫‰∫ÜVM
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã547 ‚Äî March 26, 2025

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Go on the PlayStation 2 ‚Äî If you like tinkering with consoles and shoe-horning Go into new (or old?) environments, this post is for you. It involves TinyGo, C, and a lot of trial and¬†error.

Ricardo Gomes da Silva

Make Your App an OAuth Provider ‚Äî Use Stytch to easily add 3rd party integrations, make your app agent ready, and enable data connectivity. Be your own OAuth 2.0/OIDC Identity Provider with Stytch Connected Apps. Check out our Go¬†quickstart.

Stytch sponsor

How and Why PlanetScale Built a VM in Go ‚Äî PlanetScale is a well known cloud based MySQL host that uses the Go-powered Vitess MySQL scaler. This article covers the tale of building a virtual machine in Go to work with the SQL ASTs produced by their SQL parser and how it‚Äôs as fast (or sometimes faster) as MySQL‚Äôs own C++ approach.

Vicent Mart√≠ (PlanetScale)

IN BRIEF:

  • üìò If you've enjoyed Phuong Le's detailed Go blog posts recently (such as this one about unique), he has a new book out in early access called The Anatomy of Go.

  • üéÇ Go version 1 was released 13 years ago this week!

  • The folks on Reddit's /r/golang got to discussing unusual or unique things they've built in Go including things like ‚ñ∂Ô∏è a World of Warcraft bot, an MP3 visualizer, and code for synthesizing guitar-like sounds.

The Right Way to Do Data Fixtures in Go ‚Äî If you don‚Äôt have a strategy for data fixtures from the start, problems can show up in ways that make testing brittle. Here are some tips to get started on the right foot and prevent the need to fix your fixtures¬†later.

Brandur Leach

golangci-lint v2: A Fast Linter Runner for Go ‚Äî A tool for running Go code linters (about 100 of them!), quickly, in parallel, with caching, YAML configuration, IDE integration, and more. There are some helpful migration instructions if you‚Äôre upgrading from¬†v1.

GolangCI Contributors

Goavatar: Generate Unique, Symmetric Identicons Based on a¬†String ‚Äî Given a string (like a username, say), this generates very basic icons in a deterministic way that you could use for a little added visual¬†recognition.

Muhammad Saim

Physix.go: A Simple Physics Engine for Go ‚Äî An interesting project from a high school student (who explains the background to this project here) providing basic physics capabilities when using Ebitengine.

Rudransh Bhardwaj

gocodewalker: A Way to 'Walk' Directories of Code ‚Äî If you want to walk through a nested set of directories in a code repo while respecting .gitignore, this is for¬†you.

Ben Boyter

go-profile: A Port of Brendan Gregg's eBPF profile.py ‚Äî eBPF opens up a way to do profiling in a faster, more direct way on Linux (details here) and this is an initial incomplete attempt to port a Python-powered eBPF profiler to¬†Go.

Ben Baker

mus-go: MUS Format Serialization Library ‚Äî MUS is a binary serialization format focused on¬†simplicity.
